summary:
My latest books: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09C51X3JS
Free excerpts: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/here-i-wrote-mark-smalley/
Most recent articles: https://www.linkedin.com/in/marksmalley/recent-activity/articles/ 
Older articles: https://itchronicles.com/author/marksmalley/

--- Bio for conferences etc. ---

Mark Smalley helps IT people understand service. He also helps writers write better books.

Writer, speaker, consultant and bridge builder at Smalley.IT. Also known as The IT Paradigmologist. He helps people discover where they are and to visualize where they want to be. His main area of interest is the management of IT systems and services. Mark is a contributor to bodies of knowledge such as ASL, BiSL, BRM, COBIT, DevOps, IT4IT, ITIL, VeriSM and XLA. He has spoken at hundreds of events in more than thirty countries. 

Books: ITIL 4 High-velocity IT, Reflections on High-velocity IT, ITIL 4 High-velocity IT Reference and Study Guide, Reflections on IT Paradigmology, Reflections on Product to Value, XLA Pocketbook (editor), ITSM Value Streams (editor). 
Contributor to ABC of ICT, Applicatiesourcing (Dutch), COBIT Enabling Information, Digital Practitioner Body of Knowledge, ICT Zakboek (Dutch), IT4IT Management Guide, ITIL® 4 Foundation, Operating Model Canvas, VeriSM, ITIL 4 Acquiring and Managing Cloud Services (chapter 4). 
White papers: Defining the IT Operating Model, Delivering Business Value with IT, Elevating the IT Service Experience, and The Business Value of DevOps. 

--- End of bio ---

Note for cold callers: If you are selling, it's doubtful whether I am buying. I am a one-man-show and like it that way. I have no need for further automation of my business. But feel free to get in touch if you have given our potential relationship some thought.

projects.title: China IT Service Management Conference 2008,2009,2010
projects.description: The China IT Service Management Conference is the annual event for the IT Service management industry. This is the most popular and indepedent IT management conference in China. More than 1000 international and Chinese IT experts, CIOs has been gethered to exchange their experience and knowledge for information management during the event.

profile_positions.title: Speaker

profile_positions.description: Giarte, a research and advisory firm for customer experience in IT and the founder of XLA®, has engaged Mark Smalley as Content Architect to support the growth of their XLA® Academy. Mark has extensive experience in the IT managed services sector and has contributed to many IT management frameworks and standards, most recently as Lead Editor of the ITIL® 4 High-velocity IT module. ITIL® 4 includes experience level agreements and XLA® as part of its guidance to rethink and reconstruct IT service management. Mark sees his involvement with Giarte as a continuation of his work to foster new ways of thinking and working: "The XLA® Academy is on a mission to educate, enlighten and inspire people to liberate themselves from the oppressive regimes of ineffective Service Level Agreements. The case for XLA® is compelling. Service experience affects both the direct business impact of IT services, and the broader benefits of meaningful and rewarding employee experience. It appeals to managers and practitioners who are motivated by the privilege of contributing to the well-being and prosperity of digital service consumers."
profile_positions.title: Content Architect

profile_positions.description: DASA Ambassadors are a passionate and dedicated group of individuals that plan and execute specific programs that enable and empower local and regional community-driven activities. Their contributions take many forms which include hosting online and onsite events, driving engagement via social channels, contributing thought leadership in the shape of articles, white papers, and blogs. They dedicate their professional and personal time to give a local voice to DASA as we continue to expand our members-driven community by actively contributing and advocating skills and knowledge development based on DASA's Competence model and certification scheme.
